entry.title: Bitcoin Forking Guide
entry.summary:
The [bcap project](https://github.com/bitcoin-cap/bcap) provides insights into consensus changes within Bitcoin, highlighting the importance of establishing a social consensus before implementing any code alterations that actualize these changes. This approach emphasizes the necessity of gaining widespread agreement on proposed modifications to ensure their successful integration and acceptance within the Bitcoin network. The author of the email has created a guide ([link](https://ajtowns.github.io/bfg/)) aimed at offering a more detailed perspective on how to navigate the complex process of making consensus changes in Bitcoin. This guide does not purport to be an exhaustive manual but rather serves as an advisory document, underscoring the lack of enforceability of its recommendations beyond the moral persuasion of one's conscience or the supportive feedback from the community.
The guide suggests a cooperative approach to consensus changes, advocating for changes that benefit the entire Bitcoin ecosystem. It stresses that proposals should aim for improvements that are universally recognized as positive, thus facilitating a smoother path to consensus. Notably, the guide also acknowledges the limitations of its approach, recognizing that it may not provide a viable route for proposals predicated on utilitarian principles where benefits to the majority may come at the expense of a few. Such proposals, according to the guide, are likely to face challenges in achieving consensus and could remain in limbo without broad support.
Moreover, the guide clarifies that following its recommendations involves delving into intricate details and undertaking significant work to address various aspects of the proposed changes meticulously. It makes clear that the guide is not intended as a shortcut for manipulating a system as valuable and complex as Bitcoin but as a roadmap for navigating the intricacies of consensus building within a decentralized framework. Through this approach, the guide aims to foster a constructive and inclusive dialogue around consensus changes, promoting a methodical and thoughtful process that prioritizes the collective well-being of the Bitcoin community.
